article_title: Russia Squeezes Critics at Home by Declaring Them ‘Foreign Agents’
article_text:
MOSCOW—What do a puppet theater, a torture investigator and a forest-preservation group have in common? In Russia, all are considered “foreign agents” and could face closure.

The Kremlin’s move in recent months to tighten regulations on such groups has sent a shudder through Russia’s fragile civil society. It forced one of the country’s most respected human-rights watchdogs to close, and threatens many small groups that depend on...

twitter.description: The Kremlin’s move in recent months to tighten regulations on activist groups that receive funding from abroad has sent a shudder through Russia’s fragile civil society.
twitter.creator: @tggrove
